meanings.definition: The quality of being easily influenced or controlled.
meanings.sent1: Her manipulability made her an easy target for persuasion.
meanings.sent2: The manipulability of the situation allowed for a quick resolution.
meanings.sent3: His manipulability in choosing what to eat led to an interesting dinner.
meanings.sent4: The manipulability of the clay in the potter's hands was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The manipulability of the weather made planning the picnic challenging.

meanings.definition: The ability to be manipulated or handled skillfully.
meanings.sent1: The robot's manipulability allowed it to perform delicate tasks.
meanings.sent2: She admired the artist's manipulability with colors on the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The magician's manipulability with cards amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The negotiator's manipulability in the discussion was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's manipulability on stage captivated the audience.
